title: Mol HCl produced from 6.0 mol C3H8 and 20. mol Cl2

content.prompt:
C3H8(g) + 4 Cl2(g) â†’ C3H4Cl4(g) + 4 HCl(g)

A 6.0 mol sample of C3H8(g) and a 20. mol sample of Cl2(g) are placed in a previously evacuated vessel, where they react according to the equation above. After one of the reactants has been totally consumed, how many moles of HCl(g) have been produced?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
